doc:section.name: overview
doc:section.doc:heading: Overview
doc:section.p: RabbitMQ releases include a special binary package for MacOS. It is minimalistic and not opinionated in how it is installed, configured and managed. This package is recommended in environments where more opinionated installation options (the Debian or RPM packages, Homebrew, BSD ports) cannot be used. It is also the most convenient option for running multiple versions on the same machine in development environments, e.g. preview release testing.
There are separate binary packages for Linux, MacOS and BSD as well as for Windows.

r:downloads.r:download: Packaged for Mac systems (tar.xz) shipping Erlang &standalone-otp-version; (from GitHub, recommended)

doc:subsection.name: erlang-provided
doc:subsection.doc:heading: Erlang Runtime is Included
doc:subsection.p: This build of RabbitMQ incudes an Erlang runtime. That means that there is no need to install Erlang separately to run RabbitMQ.

doc:subsection.name: dependencies
doc:subsection.doc:heading: Dependencies
doc:subsection.p: This package requires OpenSSL 1.1.x or 1.0.x installed. We strongly recommend doing this via Homebrew to avoid possible issues with dynamic library paths.

doc:subsection.name: install
doc:subsection.doc:heading: Install the Server
doc:subsection.p: Download a rabbitmq-server-generic-unix-&version-server;.tar.xz archive and extract it.
